entry.title: Using T.code ME2ON User able to create multiple deliveries with reference to same PO line item.
entry.content:
Dear Colleague,
We are currently working with T-code ME2ON (Subcontracting Cockpit) in our SAP S/4HANA 2021 (on-premise) system.
We have observed that the system allows users to create multiple outbound deliveries for the same subcontracting purchase order line item.
We need to implement a control to restrict this behavior, ideally allowing only a single delivery per PO item, or preventing the creation of a subsequent delivery once one has already been created.


Could you please advise if there are any standard Master Data or Configuration options available to enforce this restriction? If standard configuration is insufficient, what is the recommended enhancement or user exit approach?

 

Thanks & Regards, 

Manohar

entry.title: MD01N Behavior: Provision Stock at Subcontractor Location Not Considered
entry.content:
We are encountering an issue with the MD01N transaction where it does not appear to recognize stock already provided to a subcontractor (supplier) for use in subcontracting orders.

The Problem: MD01N is generating additional purchase requisitions (PRs) for components that are already available at the subcontractor location.

Observed System Behavior: The system is not treating the provision stock that we have already supplied to the subcontractor as stock that is available for use (similar to unrestricted-use stock) within our main plant's MRP run. This leads to an incorrect demand calculation and the creation of unnecessary PRs.

Please note: We are not using subcontractor MRP areas to manage this stock, and  user dont want to have subcontractor MRP areas.

Required Input: We need your input to help us understand and resolve this issue. Specifically, we need to identify the reason why MD01N does not treat the stock already available for a subcontractor as available/unrestricted-use stock within the plant's MRP calculation when subcontractor MRP areas are not in use.

Could you please provide guidance on the necessary configuration, master data settings, or potential solution that would allow MD01N to correctly consider the provision stock at the subcontractor location?

Please let us know if you require any additional information, such as specific material or plant details.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

 

 

Best regards,

Manohar.

entry.title: Inbound Delivery Types Assignment to Purchase Order Type NB
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to know if it's possible to assign two different types of inbound deliveries to the same purchase order type NB.

I created a new inbound delivery type ZLE, based on the standard delivery type LE. However, when trying to assign it to the confirmation control key, I’m unable to copy or reference the standard LA type.

The requirement is as follows:

For one specific process using PO type NB, we need to work with movement types 103/105.

In another process (also using PO type NB), we require movement types 107/109.

In both cases, an inbound delivery is mandatory.

Is there a way to achieve this setup? Any suggestions or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,

entry.title: why Inbound delivery can't be displayed individually in MD04
entry.content:
Dear Experts, I need your expertise regarding an issue we're encountering. As depicted in the attached screenshot, there are three LA entries for item 20 in the PO confirmation tab, each with a different LA number and distinct delivery dates. However, MD04 is only displaying a single line. Ideally, MD04 should show three separate shipment lines to reflect the individual delivery dates accurately. at the same time, the PO notes (AB conformation) displayed by individual delivery dates.

Do you have any suggestions or insights into this LA MD04 display issue? Any feedback or guidance you can provide would be greatly appreciated. Thanks so much!

 #SAP ECC ERP, #Production Planning and Control > Material Requirements Planning, #Confirmation control #MD04

entry.title: is it possible to amend RM code to convert for Sale module
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have a raw material code created in the system. We manufacture a final product with these materials. We have a surplus of raw materials stored for a long time, and we need to sell them. How can I do this? Do I create new codes for these materials and treat them as a final product, or what? Please advise me.

Thank you

Since there are lot of people did SAP MM i am not choosing it!

Please share your suggestions!

TIA!!!

entry.title: Advanced Variant configuration processing mode
entry.content:
We are upgrading from SAP 2020 to SAP 2023 FP03 and we have seen a new field 'Processing mode' showing three options

1) Advanced Variant Configuration 2) Mixed and 3) Classic

Post upgrade we are seeing issue with our Characteristics that have multiple values. Some are set to 'Mixed' processing which is erroring but when we change the processing mode to 'Classic' we receive the same error ?

Our expectation is that Classic mode allows multiple same values in key field.

any help appreciated

entry.title: Shipment Tracking
entry.content: Is there a way for my transportation team to update shipment statuses in SAP? Currently, they are tracking all shipments offline and they do not update it in a timely manner. What I am looking for is after a STO/PO is created, if the transportation team can confirm it is picked up, in transit, delayed and then delivered in SAP?

entry.title: Erfassung Wertkorrektur vom ERP Bestand - ohne den EWM Bestand zu bewegen
entry.content:
Hallo, 

wir müssen bei uns bei 394 Identnummern, die Bewertungsklassen ändern, um das möglich machen zu können, muss ich den ERP Bestand ausbuchen und wieder einbuchen. 
Ich bin erst seit 2 Monaten bei SAP dabei und mich verwirrt diese Anleitung ein wenig: 
2178045 - Alternativen zur Erfassung von Wareneingangskorrekturen im EWM - SAP for Me

 

Hier gibt es so viele Auswahlmöglichkeiten, was ist hier das richtige? 

Ich bitte euch um Unterstützung! Gegebenenfalls kennt jemand bereits die Thematik.

Danke im Voraus! 

Liebe Grüße

David

entry.title: What are the major challenges you faced while implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management?
entry.content:
Q: What are the major challenges you faced while implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management in a manufacturing setup?

We’re in the early stages of implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management (SCM) in our manufacturing operations, and I’d like to learn from others who have gone through this journey. While Dynamics 365 SCM promises powerful capabilities like automation, predictive analytics, and real-time visibility, the actual implementation process often brings unexpected challenges—especially in complex manufacturing environments.

For those who’ve implemented D365 SCM, what were the biggest obstacles you encountered during or after deployment?

  1. Data Migration: How challenging was it to migrate legacy data from older ERP or MES systems into Dynamics 365 SCM? Were there issues with data consistency or structure?
  2. Customization & Configuration: Did you need to heavily customize workflows, or were the out-of-the-box features sufficient for your manufacturing processes?

It would also be great if you could share some best practices or lessons learned that helped your organization overcome these challenges. For example, did you involve cross-functional teams early in the project, or use Microsoft partners/consultants to streamline the process?

entry.title: How can blockchain integration with SAP enhance supply chain transparency and security?
entry.content: Blockchain technology is gaining traction in various industries for its ability to enhance transparency, security, and traceability. In the context of SAP systems, integrating blockchain can revolutionize supply chain management by providing an immutable ledger of transactions and real-time tracking of goods. This post explores how combining SAP with blockchain can improve data security, reduce fraud, and increase trust among partners in the supply chain. What are your thoughts or experiences on implementing blockchain within SAP environments for better supply chain transparency?

entry.title: Inbound delivery attachment
entry.content:

User is attaching the PDF documents as attachment in change inbound delivery app as we are using WM. Another user wants to see that attachment in VL33N as that user have only display access. When user click on service object --> attachment list in VL33N, it is grayed out and user can't see the attachment.

Can you share the details how to achieve this requirement.

Thanks

Pavan

entry.title: Why wouldn't a minority indicator populate for every line on a PO?
entry.content:
Hi everyone, 

I have a question surrounding minority indicators. Why wouldn't a minority indicator populate for every line on a PO? At the vendor master level, the minority indicator is populated for a supplier but when a purchase order is released, not every line populates the minority indicator. 

Any insight into this? Appreciate any guidance.

entry.title: Subcontracting delivery MESSAGE ME151 (0 item(s) posted)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I was facing 0 item(s) posted message while doing subcontracting delivery using ME2O, step followed is explained as below. Kindly request your valuable advice.!

Step 1: Master data set up, shipping point, delivery type related configuration completed

Step 2: Created subcontracting PO using ME21N
Step 3: Trying to create delivery using T code ME2O
Step 4: Shipping point is determining as per set up.
Step 5: Entered storage location, respective batch and quantity and click on continue
Step 6: Delivery not created, instead its showing message as 0 item(s) posted


We have enough stock for component material with respective storage location and batch.

T code used-ME2O
Environment- SAP ECC

Kindly request your valuable advice on same.

Awaiting your replay.!

Regards,

Prashanth
